==Japanese==

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|け|さ|yomi=irreg}}
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=けさ}}. Originally a compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=きょう|此|tr1=ke|t1=this|朝|tr2=asa|t2=morning}}.

The initial {{IPAchar|/ke/}} is an alternative form of the initial {{IPAchar|/ko/}} ({{l|ja|此}}, “this”) seen in words such as {{m|ja|ここ|tr=koko||this place → here}} or {{m|ja|これ|tr=kore||this [nominal] → this}}, and the final {{IPAchar|/sa/}} is a contraction from *{{IPAchar|/ke.asa/}} to {{IPAchar|/kesa/}} with the [[medial]] {{IPAchar|-a-}} falling out, as {{etyl|ojp|-}} did not permit vowel clusters.

The use of the kanji {{m|ja|今||now}} instead of {{m|ja|此||this}} is an example of [[熟字訓|jukujikun]].

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|けさ|yomi=kun|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

# [[this morning]]

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|こん|ちょう|yomi=o}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=こんちょう}} compound {{m|zh|今朝|tr=kim trjew|lit=now morning}}. {{IPAchar|/konteu/}} → {{IPAchar|/kontjoː/}}. The {{IPAchar|/eu/}} → {{IPAchar|/joː/}} sound shift is a regular phonological change.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|こんちょう|yomi=goon|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====

# [[this morning]]
